intro: Bursera ribana, commonly known as the Mexican frankincense tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh-producing species. The plant is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and simple, alternate leaves that are often aromatic. It produces small, yellow flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing three seeds. The sap of Bursera ribana has been used traditionally for its aromatic and medicinal properties.
